flawed_nl_solution:
The price of the cheaper pair after the discount was $40/2 = $<<40/2=20>>20
The total price of both pairs of shoes $20 + $60 = $<<20+60=76>>76
The final discount was $76/4 = $<<76/4=19>>19
The price he ends up paying was $76 - $19 = <<76-19=57>>57
#### 57

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 80, not 76. This appears to be a minor miscalculation.
